titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:51

did.unittitle: Uganda collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, printed material, and photographs relating to the history and current political, economic, and social conditions in Uganda.

langmaterial.language: The material is in English, Luganda, and Swahili.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Uganda Collection (MS 1548). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: African Collection, MS 605; African Postcard Collection, MS 1575; Pamphlet Collection, MS 1351. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, printed material, and photographs relating to the history and current political, economic, and social conditions in Uganda.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material in the first accession is arranged chronologically, with photographs last. Additions to the collection may vary in arrangement.

did.unittitle: Inventory
[Kasagama, Dandi, Omukama of Toro?]: correspondence to unidentified recipient (written in [Luganda?])

"Independence Anniversary": program of celebrations
